Chuck Hinson wrote:
> For those of us unfamiliar with the movie or the genre, why is this a
> great analogy?  What does it illustrate?

Sergio Leone's films were set in the same period of American History as 
other Westerns, but broke with so many of the expectations of that genre 
as to not fit it.

They are normally considered Westerns, but do not follow the rules of 
Westerns.
